channel.title: News on Chicago Human+AI Lab
channel.description: Recent content in News on Chicago Human+AI Lab

item.title: A Symposium on Human+AI
item.description: September 29, 2023, 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM John Crerar Library, Room 390 AI has achieved impressive success in a wide variety of domains, ranging from medical diagnosis to generative AI. This success provides rich opportunities for AI to address important societal challenges, but there are also growing concerns about the bias and harm that AI systems may cause. This conference brings together diverse perspectives to think about the best way for AI to fit into society and how to develop the best AI for humans.

item.title: New Paper on Active Example Selection
item.description: Checkout this blog post for our EMNLP 2022 paper Active Example Selection for In-Context Learning!

item.title: Human-Centered Evaluations of Explanations at NAACL 2022
item.description: We gave a tutorial on human-centered evaluation of explanations at NAACL, and the recorded videos are on YouTube!

item.title: Postdoc Position on Human-centered AI
item.description: We have a postdoc opening on human-centered AI. Please email Chenhao your CV and names of references!

item.title: Postdoc Position through DSI Fellowship
item.description: In Fall 2002, we will also have openings for postdocs through the DSI fellowship!
